revised_title: Thermal Transpiration and the Heterogeneous Structure of Gases
tldr: The author conducted experiments on thermal transpiration, the motion of gases caused by temperature differences, through porous plates. They discovered that gases possess a heterogeneous structure, meaning they are not a continuous plenum, and found a law that explains the differences in transpiration rates through plates of different coarseness. This discovery provides an experimental demonstration that gas is not a continuous substance and supports the molecular theory of gases.
